name: Torrey Schoolhouse B&B Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stop on a Grand Circle tour of the National Park's in Utah, and it set us off on a good start. Torrey is the location of Capitol Reef NP, our first major destination. The B&B is a an old schoolhouse, beautifully restored and decorated with period touches, pictures of alumni, and historical memorabilia. Facilities include a massage chair (which the inn-keeper assured us was put there just for us!)
reviews.title: Warm and Welcoming; Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at about dinner time and found our key and room information waiting. We had requested a ground floor room to avoiding having to haul luggage upstairs. It was their "accessible" room, and although a trifle cozy, was perfrectly comfortable in all respects. We called the inn-keeper, as requested, to announce our arrival and get a restaurant recommendation -- and we got a good one!
reviews.title: Torrey Schoolhouse B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the morning, coffee was available starting at 7:30am, breakfast was at 8:30, served around big tables that let guests get acquainted. Our breakfast companions were two charming couples, one from the UK, one from South Africa. The breakfast itself was an egg-cheese souffle and Canadian bacon, plus breads, jams, juice, etc. A real treat. We picked this B&B in part because of the TripAdvisor recommendation. We are happy to reinforce the recommendation!
reviews.title: Great potential unrealized

reviews.text: Just west of Capitol Reef National Park Proprietor Ty Markham has renovated an old schoolhouse into an oasis in the desert. Enter through the garden into the spacious first floor common room filled with art, historical photos, great books and music. Rooms are light and airy with views of red rock mountains all around. Delicious breakfasts are prepared by Ty who uses ingredients from her personal organic garden. Ty is always available to help make your stay comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Torrey

reviews.title: Not A Good Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Torrey Schoolhouse was an outstanding stay. The gardens are fabulous and the owner/hostess was a delight. Our room was charming and comfortable and our breakfast was delicious. I wish we had planned to stay more than one night.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay in Torrey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a delight to enjoy the spacious elegance of the converted schoolhouse. Our room was delightful with all amenities. The reception building and gardens are exquisite. I recommend this Inn for it's unique elegance and experience.
reviews.title: An exceptionally stylish and comfortable accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was disappointing but far outweighed by the graceful ambiance of the whole. We were lucky not to have missed this experience.
reviews.title: BINGO! A CHARMING OASIS IN SMALL TOWN UTAH

reviews.text: What a delight to enter this spacious, beautifully restored historic building. Well designed with attention to detail Torrey Schoolhouse is an oasis of elegance in a crusty environment. Our light, airy, white, comfortable, spacious room provided a delightful contrast to the reds/browns/yellows of the surrounding environment.
reviews.title: All B&Bs could take a lesson from Torrey Schoohouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sumptuous breakfast was delicious. The easy access computer helpful. The large backyard, beautifully landscaped, was a huge surprise. Oasis indeed.
reviews.title: Can't recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for only one night in the Arithmetic Room. It was just as described on the website -- really a perfect retreat in Torrey. The massage chair in each room was a nice touch, and the views from the b & b are incredible. It is really nice to stay in a place steeped in so much history.
reviews.title: Amazing retreat - don't miss this one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was phenomenal, Ty was very friendly and helpful, and the overall experience was superb.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms and gardens!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the poster who posted about the lack of soap in the bathrooms, you'll be happy to know that our room came stocked with very chic toiletries.
reviews.title: Incredible, first class B & B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely stay here if you will be going through Torrey!
reviews.title: Beautiful b and b in a beautiful setting next to Capitol Reef National Park.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And Cafe Diablo was excellent, though beware that the portions are huge. Save room for dessert.
reviews.title: First Class B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Torrey Schoolhouse B&B Inn in May 2010. The inn, housed in the completely gutted and rebuilt 1916 Torrey, Utah stone schoolhouse, was a great place to stay. The inn dominates a side street in a residential neighborhood two blocks off Utah Rt. 24, but the residences are set very far apart from one another in this high, dry, arid landscape, and Torrey is a tiny town.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Accommodations, Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, one of the lesser expensive in the inn, was extremely comfortable. The ceilings in all the rooms are very high and each room has huge windows overlooking the nearby hills or the gardens. Because of the high ceilings and huge windows, the rooms are bright, airy, and inviting. Most of the rooms are painted white, which adds to the brightness, but is a bit stark.
reviews.title: Elegance in rural Utah

reviews.text: Each room has an addictive Sharper Image massage chair.
reviews.title: excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast, served in the large communal room on the first floor, features very generous helpings of freshly cooked breakfast entrees, many of which contain organic vegetables straight from the proprietor's/owner's greenhouse and gardens. The fare is delicious and plentiful; there's no reason to go away from breakfast hungry. And, if you don't want breakfast, you'll get a substantial reduction on the tariff.
reviews.title: Epitome of Peace and quiet"
Light, lovely peaceful
reviews.text: The owner/proprietor/hostess is very outgoing, gracious, accommodating and welcoming. If you ask her about the history of the schoolhouse and the inn, she'll happily recite the whole fascinating story. She had plenty of good (and reliable) suggestions for eating in Torrey.

description: The Torrey Schoolhouse B&B Inn provides lodging in a historic pioneer setting. The Inn was once the lifeblood of the whole county, including weekend dances, country bands, boxing matches, sometimes attended by local outlaws including Butch Cassidy. The Inn is close to hiking, biking, scenic trails, horseback riding, tours, and is the perfect base for your next National Park adventure! If you are planning a tour of Bryce Canyon, Canyonlands, or Lake Powell, don't forget to include the diverse and spectacular Capitol Reef National Park on your route! A stay inTorrey to enjoy great food at award-winning restaurants, and to revive yourself with our Sharper Image rolling-action massage-recliners is a special treat. Come and relax and enjoy the historic elegance that awaits you at the Schoolhouse Bed and Breakfast Inn!Located in the heart of Torrey, Utah--only minutes from the entrance to Capitol Reef National Park--the Torrey Schoolhouse Bed and Breakfast Inn is the most convenient and luxurious lodging accommodation at Capitol Reef. Providing delicious ORGANIC full hot breakfasts, the Schoolhouse Bed and Breakfast Inn is also a wellness retreat. It is truly where "Capitol Reef meets comfort!"
